subject: Re: [junit] Re: Using Mock objects or another system?
msgSnippet: On Thu, 10 Apr 2003 15:21:06 -0700 (PDT), Kevin Klinemeier ... They also tend to be longer. =jason [:question | ^One]
messageBody:
On Thu, 10 Apr 2003 15:21:06 -0700 (PDT), "Kevin Klinemeier"
<zipwow@...> said:
> This message only has an HTML part -- this is a text generated
> representation
>
>
> > What would you say is the advantage of DBUnit over the method my
> > coworker suggested (using JUnit with two custom methods for writing
> > test data in the database and deleting it after the test is run)?
> This approach can't test failure states (unexpected duplicate item,
> dropped connection, etc).
> Also, if you have more developers than databases (typically the case)
> then the developer's tests will step on each other, causing
> intermittant failures.
> -Kevin

They also tend to be longer.
=jason
[:question | ^One]
